Name: School Security - Requiring a school emergency preparedness task force to review emergency communication technologies at schools.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a school emergency preparedness task force to review emergency communication technologies at schools

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Summary: This bill would require a school emergency preparedness task force to review and make recommendations relating to the ability of a school to communicate to NYPD in the event of an emergency.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1.  Subdivision g of section 14-176 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by a local law for the year 2018 amending the administrative code of the city of New York relating to creating a school emergency preparedness task force, as proposed in introduction number 639-B, is amended by adding a new paragraph 4 to read as follows: 
      4. communication technologies for notifying the department in the event of a school emergency;
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.
      
BG
LS 5986
8/17/18

1
